0.user_question: $5742518 is shared among 3 boys. The eldest added $5 to his share and added another $10 the following day. He later needed some money and spent $8 from his total so far. After saving some more, he was able to triple the amount he had left after spending the $8. How much does he have now?

ost_step.1: Divide $5742518 equally amongst three boys; each boy gets $5742518 / 3 = $1914172.66 (rounded).
ost_step.2: Eldest brother first adds $5 which brings him up to $1914172.66 + $5 = $1914177.66.
ost_step.3: On the second day, he then adds another $10 making it $1914177.66 + $10 = $1914187.66.

direct_answer.text:
Now let’s calculate further based on these steps we found before using hint information. When our third condition comes into play – subtracting eight ($8) because this person needs cash – their balance becomes reduced as follows :  
Total sum = Initial Total Sum X Amount Remaining AFTER Subtraction   
= $1914187.66(Amount Received By Eldest Brother From Hint Information And Calculation Prior To This Point) – $8    
=$1914179.66     
In accordance with what happened next according to conditions mentioned above, when he triples his current savings or shares after withdrawal , His new saved total would look like this ;         
New Saved Share Of Money Left With Him = Current Saving Or Shared Balance × Tripled Value       
                         = $1914179.66× 3      
                = $5742538.98           
So Final

direct_answer.text:
First let us define variable X such that when divided amongst equals yields Y value per person i..e.$$X \div N =Y \\\impliesN=\frac{X}{Y}$$Now since you mention equal distribution; $$\therefore\\X_i=(Total sum)/(NoofBoy)$$\begin{align*}And hence,\quad Total Amount&=(SumOfEach)=(NumberOffreeds)\times(PricePerFred)\\&=((a)+b+c)(p)$$Where $\textstyle b=$ Number Of Bagels ,$\textstyle c=$ Money Spent And Finally,$(\textsf{$Money Left}):MoneySpent+$BonusAmount-$ExtraExpenses.$Hence Using Algebraic Expressions We Get:-
$(A)_Totalth=&((x)+(n))*(d)-[(r)+(l)]\\&=ax+nd-(r+l)\\&\vdots\\&=nx+(bd-rl)\end{align*}$As It Is Given That Every Boy Got An Equal Share Therefore:$P_{share}=AX/(ABCD)=\frac{(AD)}{BCD}=\frac{C}{(BD)}$So Since Each Person Has Received This Much
